CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 27 It has been proved that the thienyl ring can enhance the π-π stacking intermolecular interactions and lead to a high charge carrier mobility.

Let's think step by step.

1. Thienyl ring

The term "thienyl ring" is a material name, specifically a type of aromatic heterocyclic compound. It is a five-membered ring with one sulfur atom and four carbon atoms. The presence of the sulfur atom makes it a heterocyclic compound. Thienyl rings are commonly found in organic compounds and can be used as building blocks in the synthesis of various materials. In this context, the paragraph suggests that the presence of a thienyl ring can improve the charge carrier mobility in certain materials due to enhanced π-π stacking interactions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Thienyl ring.

This is the only entity in the paragraph that can be clearly identified as a material name. The other entities, such as "it," "these materials," and "charge carrier mobility," do not provide enough context to determine their specific material identity. The paragraph only mentions the thienyl ring as a specific material that can enhance charge carrier mobility through π-π stacking interactions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 27 It has been proved that the thienyl ring can enhance the π-π stacking intermolecular interactions and lead to a high charge carrier mobility.

Let's think step by step.

1. thienyl ring: This is a specific type of aromatic ring system, which can be considered a property or feature of certain molecules. It is the structural entity that is enhancing the intermolecular interactions and leading to high charge carrier mobility.
2. π-π stacking intermolecular interactions: This is a type of intermolecular force that occurs when the π systems (systems of overlapping p orbitals) of two or more molecules align and interact with each other. It is a property that can influence the charge carrier mobility.
3. high charge carrier mobility: This is a physical property that describes how easily charge carriers (electrons or holes) can move through a material. It is influenced by various factors, including the strength of intermolecular forces and the structure of the material.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.
1. high charge carrier mobility: This is a material property that describes how easily charge carriers (electrons or holes) move through a material.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| high charge carrier mobility |
